starvationevasion.common

Class Policy

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.common.Policy
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CleanRiverIncentivePolicy, CovertIntelligencePolicy, EducateTheWomenCampaignPolicy, EfficientIrrigationIncentivePolicy, EthanolProductionTaxCreditChangePolicy, FertilizerSubsidyPolicy, ForeignAidForFarmInfrastructurePolicy, GMOSeedInsectResistanceResearchPolicy, InternationalFoodReliefProgramPolicy, MyPlatePromotionCampaignPolicy

    public abstract class Policy
extends java.lang.Object
    Policy is the structure that the Server uses to tell the Simulator which policies have been enacted on the current game turn.

    The game client's might want to extend this class adding, for example, an image, a status (in deck, in hand, proposed, voting, enacted, rejected) and other data.
    If the client does extend this class, be sure to downcast to Policy before sending across the network to the server.

    Use the validate() method to verify all needed parameters of the policy are defined and in range.

      • targetFood

        protected EnumFood targetFood
        This field is ignored if this policy does not require a target food.

      • targetRegion

        protected EnumRegion targetRegion
        Some cards require the target region to be a US player region. Other cards require the target region to be a non-player world region. This field is ignored if this policy does not require a target region.

      • varX

        protected int varX
        Some policy cards require quantity X, Y and/or Z. The units of these values are depend on the particular policy. The field is ignored if this policy does not require that field.

      • varY

        protected int varY
        Some policy cards require quantity X, Y and/or Z. The units of these values are depend on the particular policy. The field is ignored if this policy does not require that field.

      • varZ

        protected int varZ
        Some policy cards require quantity X, Y and/or Z. The units of these values are depend on the particular policy. The field is ignored if this policy does not require that field.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Policy

        public Policy(EnumRegion owner)
        Constructs a policy card owned by the given owner of the given policy. Many properties of the policy may be set and changed, but the owner and policy are immutable.
        Parameters:
        owner - US player region controlled by the player who drafts this policy.

      • votesRequired

        public abstract int votesRequired()
        Returns:
        0 if the policy is automatic. Otherwise, returns the number of votes required for the policy to be enacted.

      • voteWaitForAll

        public abstract boolean voteWaitForAll()
        Returns:
        true if voting should continue until all eligible players have voted on this policy. Return false if voting should stop as soon as the required number of votes have been reached.

      • clearVotes

        public void clearVotes()
        Clears all enacting regions.

      • addEnactingRegion

        public void addEnactingRegion(EnumRegion region)
        The Server is responsible for verifying and setting each enacting region of all policy cards requiring a vote (votesRequired() > 0).

        Each policy sent to the simulator must be enacted by at least one US region.

        Automatic policies are always and only enacted by the region who played the policy card.

        Some policy cards that require voting may be enacted by more than one region. In some cases, only the regions that voted for the policy enact it. In other cases (generally for international policies) either all US regions enact the policy or none do.
        Parameters:
        region - a United States region that will be enacting the policy.

      • didVoteYes

        public boolean didVoteYes(EnumRegion region)
        Parameters:
        region - a United States region.
        Returns:
        true iff the given region voted to approve the policy.

      • getEnactingRegionCount

        public int getEnactingRegionCount()
        Returns:
        Number of US regions who voted yes for this policy.

      • validatePercentValue

        public java.lang.String validatePercentValue(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - a policy percentage amount.
        Returns:
        null iff the amount is within range. Otherwise returns an error message.

      • validateDollarValue

        public java.lang.String validateDollarValue(int n)
        Parameters:
        n - a policy amount in millions of dollars.
        Returns:
        null iff the amount is within range. Otherwise returns an error message.

      • getPolicyName

        public java.lang.String getPolicyName()

      • validate

        public abstract java.lang.String validate()
        Different policy cards require different data to be valid.
        The simulator uses this method to validate enacted policy cards.
        Note: The client should never send the server invalid cards. If the simulator does find an error then either there is a bug in the client or the client has been hacked.
        Returns:
        null if the policy is valid. Otherwise, returns an error message.
